lines.content: This project is named after the Java mascot Duke. Duke, is a command line
program to keep track of your tasks in a list.
__Duke__ is run with a file ending with extension `.jar`. Click [here](https://github.com/liping-eng/ip/releases) to download the JAR file for running latest version of __Duke__.
1. Open your Command Line on your desktop.
2. Go to the directory where you stored the JAR file.
Now you should see __Duke__ welcoming you!
Duke allows you to add three different type of tasks in your list:
- Todo - tasks you plan to do. This is denoted as `[T]` in your task list!
- Deadline - tasks that contains a deadline. This is denoted as `[D]` in your task list!
- Event - event you wish to attend. This is denoted as `[E]` in your task list!
- Duke saves your list of tasks every time you input your command `[Refer to Commands Summary to see the full list of commands!]` and
saves your progress even after you exit the program!
Duke also allows you to delete tasks from your list. Below is the before and after of the list of tasks with the use of command `delete 1`.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Here are the tasks in your list:
Duke allows you to list all of your tasks with the command `list`. Below is an illustration of the use of command `list`.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Duke allows you to mark tasks as done! Below shows the before and after list of tasks with the use of command `done 1`.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Here are the tasks in your list:
Duke can help you find your tasks in the list too! Given a word, Duke can help to filter out tasks that contain the keyword you specified!
Below shows the initial list of tasks and the filtered list of tasks that contains the keyword.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Duke can handle simple error handling too!
#### Below is a table that illustrates the list of commands available.
todo \<task\> | Adds a ToDo task object to the list
deadline \<task\> /by \<date or time\> | Adds a Deadline task object to the list
event \<task\> /at \<venue or date\> | Adds a Deadline task object to the list
list | Prints the tasks in a list with indexing
delete \<task index\> | Removes the task at specified task index
done \<task index\> | Mark task at specified task index with a `X`
find \<keyword\> | Find and print tasks that contains the keyword
bye | Exits and terminates Duke. Progress is saved.
###### Note: \<something\> refers to user input to be decided by the user.
This section shows input and expected output of the commands with the use of examples.
Note: Words CAPITALISED in this section refers user input to be decided by the user.
### `todo` - Adds a ToDo task object to the list
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
### `deadline` - Adds a Deadline task object to the list
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
### `event` - Adds a Event task object to the list
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 5 tasks in the list.
### `list` - Prints the tasks in a list with indexing
Here are the tasks in your list:

Now you have 4 tasks in the list.

###### Duke is still not capable of doing many functions sadly...
###### pst... He is trying his best to learn! :)
`OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(`
### Hope you have fun using Duke! More functionalities to come...!

* Checks if command entered by user is complete.
* A complete command follows the format for the command.
* Descriptions as whitespaces in command is deemed as incomplete command.
* This prevents user from adding meaningless tasks to the list.
public static void incompleteCommand(String userInput, String command,

* Creates text file that is to be read from if file does not exist.
* Else, read from existing text file.
public static void readFile(String filePath, TaskList tasks) throws IOException {

* i.e. todo, event, deadline, done, delete.

System.out.println("Key in an appropriate number. E.g. [done 1]");

System.out.println("Key in an appropriate number. E.g. [delete 1]");

* at the start of the program.
* Prints Duke logo and welcome message
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Prints error message when command is empty.
* @param emptyCommand Command that follows an empty user input.
System.out.println("OOPS!!! The description of a " + emptyCommand + " cannot be empty.");
* Prints error message when command is not any operations define in TaskList.
System.out.println("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
System.out.println("There was an error when creating file. Try again!");
* Prints error message when command is missing description(s).
System.out.println("You may be missing some description.");
* Prints error message if only whitespaces is entered as an input.
System.out.println("Please key in a valid command instead of whitespaces!");
* Prints error message when the command by the user
* does not follow the slash format for adding Event task and Deadline task.
public static void printWrongSlashInput(String command, String slashString) {
* Prints error message when user key in number not present in the list.
* This error message is applicable for command which requires numbering of a task,
System.out.println("No index found. Please key an appropriate index");
* Prints message after user adds a new task to the list.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task: ");
* Prints message when a new text file is created
* that is used to store list of tasks.
* Prints error message when unable to update the list of tasks

System.out.println("Error while writing to file. Try again!");
* Prints error message when reading the file
* with the specified pathname does not exist.
System.out.println("File not found. An attempt to open the file has failed.");
